data.chText: 泼洒；哗啦哗啦地溅；噼里啪啦地落
data.enText: to fall noisily onto a surface

data.chText: 水哗的一声泼洒在地板上。
data.enText: Water splashed onto the floor.

data.chText: 雨点啪啦啪啦打在窗户上。
data.enText: Rain splashed against the windows.

data.chText: 把（水、泥等）泼在…上，溅在…上；朝…上泼（或溅）
data.enText: to make sb/sth wet by making water, mud, etc. fall on them/it

data.chText: 他把冷水往脸上泼。
data.enText: He splashed cold water on his face.

data.chText: 他朝脸上泼冷水。
data.enText: He splashed his face with cold water.

data.chText: 我衣服上溅满了泥。
data.enText: My clothes were splashed with mud.

data.chText: 别溅我了！
data.enText: Stop splashing me!

data.chText: （在水中）溅着水花行走，拍打着水游
data.enText: to move through water making drops fly everywhere

data.chText: 孩子们哗啦哗啦地溅着水花从水坑里蹚过。
data.enText: The kids were splashing through the puddles.

data.chText: 人们在游泳池里或者游泳，或者只是拍打戏水，开心地玩着。
data.enText: People were having fun in the pool, swimming or just splashing around.

data.chText: 用（泼洒色斑）装饰
data.enText: to decorate sth with areas of bright colour, not in a regular pattern

data.chText: 墙壁上随意泼了大块的蓝色和紫色。
data.enText: The walls were splashed with patches of blue and purple.
splash sth across/over sth

data.chText: 把（照片、新闻报道等）安排在显著位置；在突出位置刊载
data.enText: to put a photograph, news story, etc. in a place where it will be easily noticed
splash down

data.chText: 溅落（在海洋里）
data.enText: to land in the sea or ocean
splash out (on sth)
splash sth↔out (on/for sth)

data.chText: 花大笔的钱（买某物等）
data.enText: to spend a lot of money on sth

data.chText: 我们打算挥霍一下，买辆新车。
data.enText: We're going to splash out and buy a new car.

data.chText: 他花了几百英镑买名牌服装。
data.enText: He splashed out hundreds of pounds on designer clothes.

data.chText: 落水声；溅泼声
data.enText: the sound of sth hitting liquid or of liquid hitting sth

data.chText: 她掉进游泳池时我们听见扑通的一声。
data.enText: We heard the splash when she fell into the pool.

data.chText: 溅上的液体；溅洒后留下的污渍
data.enText: a small amount of liquid that falls onto sth; the mark that this makes

data.chText: 洒在地板上的一摊摊水
data.enText: splashes of water on the floor

data.chText: 溅在她裙子上的黑泥点
data.enText: dark splashes of mud on her skirt

data.chText: 色块；光斑
data.enText: a small area of bright colour or light that contrasts with the colours around it

data.chText: 这些花会给整个夏天增添一片亮丽的色彩。
data.enText: These flowers will give a splash of colour throughout the summer.

data.chText: 掺入饮料的少量液体
data.enText: a small amount of liquid that you add to a drink

data.chText: 只加了少量牛奶的咖啡
data.enText: coffee with just a splash of milk

data.chText: （报章等旨在招徕读者的）重点文章
data.enText: an article in a newspaper, etc. that is intended to attract a lot of attention
make, cause, etc. a splash

data.chText: 引起广泛关注；引起轰动
data.enText: to do sth in a way that attracts a lot of attention or causes a lot of excitement

word_means: 溅着水花行走，拍打着水游

means: 把(水、泥等)泼在…上，溅在…上
(在水中)溅着水花行走，拍打着水游

data.enText: make, cause, etc. a splash

data.chText: 引起广泛关注；引起轰动
data.enText: to do sth in a way that attracts a lot of attention or causes a lot of excitement
splash sth across/over sth

data.chText: 把（照片、新闻报道等）安排在显著位置；在突出位置刊载
data.enText: to put a photograph, news story, etc. in a place where it will be easily noticed
splash down

data.chText: 溅落（在海洋里）
data.enText: to land in the sea or ocean
splash out (on sth)
splash sth↔out (on/for sth)

data.chText: 花大笔的钱（买某物等）
data.enText: to spend a lot of money on sth

data.chText: 我们打算挥霍一下，买辆新车。
data.enText: We're going to splash out and buy a new car.

data.chText: 他花了几百英镑买名牌服装。
data.enText: He splashed out hundreds of pounds on designer clothes.

tr: the act of scattering water about haphazardly
the act of splashing a (liquid) substance on a surface

example: her red hat gave her outfit a splash of color

tr: a small quantity of something moist or liquid
a prominent or sensational but short-lived news event
example: he made a great splash and then disappeared

tr: mark or overlay with patches of contrasting color or texture
cause to appear splashed or spattered
example: The mountain was splashed with snow

tr: dash a liquid upon or against
example: The mother splashed the baby's face with water

tr: cause (a liquid) to spatter about, especially with force
example: She splashed the water around her

tr: strike and dash about in a liquid
example: The boys splashed around in the pool

tr: soil or stain with a splashed liquid

example: We had to splosh across the wet meadow
water was splashing on the floor

value.def: If you splash about or splash around in water, you hit or disturb the water in a noisy way, causing some of it to fly up into the air.

example.ex: A lot of people were in the water, swimming or simply splashing about...
example.tran: 水里有很多人在游泳或只是在戏水玩耍。

example.ex: She could hear the voices of her friends as they splashed in a nearby rock pool...
example.tran: 她能听见自己的朋友们在附近的小石潭中嬉水的声音。

example.ex: The gliders and their pilots splashed into the lake and had to be fished out.
example.tran: 滑翔机连同驾驶员都扑通一声栽进了湖里，只能被捞出来。

value.def: If you splash a liquid somewhere or if it splashes, it hits someone or something and scatters in a lot of small drops.

example.ex: He closed his eyes tight, and splashed the water on his face...
example.tran: 他紧闭双眼，将水泼在自己脸上。

example.ex: A little wave, the first of many, splashed in my face...
example.tran: 一朵小小的浪花飞溅在我的脸上，紧接着更多的浪涌过来。

example.ex: Lorries rumbled past them, splashing them with filthy water from the potholes in the road...
example.tran: 大卡车从他们身旁轰隆隆开过，把路上坑凹里的脏水溅到了他们身上。

example.ex: He heard the sounds of splashing water and glanced at the door to the bathroom.
example.tran: 他听到水泼溅的声音，就看了一眼浴室的门。

value.def: A splash is the sound made when something hits water or falls into it.

example.ex: There was a splash and something fell clumsily into the water.
example.tran: 扑通一声，有东西重重地掉进了水里。

value.def: A splash of a liquid is a small quantity of it that falls on something or is added to something.

example.ex: Wallcoverings and floors should be able to withstand steam and splashes...
example.tran: 墙面材料和地板都应该能耐热汽且防水。

example.ex: Add a splash of lemon juice to flavor the butter.
example.tran: 加上一点柠檬汁给黄油调味。

value.tran: 洒泼上去的一点儿;添加进去的少量

value.def: A splash of colour is an area of a bright colour which contrasts strongly with the colours around it.

example.ex: Anne has left the walls white, but added splashes of colour with the tablecloth and the paintings.
example.tran: 安妮让墙壁维持白色，但用桌布及油画进行了色彩点缀。

value.tran: (与周围颜色形成强烈对照的)一片鲜艳颜色

value.def: If a magazine or newspaper splashes a story, it prints it in such a way that it is very noticeable.

example.ex: The newspapers splashed the story all over their front pages...
example.tran: 各家报纸都以整个头版醒目地刊登了这一报道。

example.ex: A picture of his girlfriend Sheryl had been splashed in the previous weekend's tabloids.
example.tran: 他的女友谢里尔的一张照片被刊登在前一周末各家通俗小报的显眼位置上。

value.def: If you make a splash, you become noticed or become popular because of something that you have done.

example.ex: Now she's made a splash in the American television show 'Civil  Wars'.
example.tran: 现在她已经凭借美国电视剧《内战》而一炮走红。
